companyDescription:
Ivey Business School (Ivey) focuses on developing leaders with case-based and experiential learning at the core of its curriculum. In addition, Ivey contributes to knowledge creation and application through the scholarly and practice-oriented work of faculty and through the support and outreach of its Research Centres and Institutes.

Ivey offers degree programs at the undergraduate level (Honours Business Administration) and post graduate levels (Full-time MBA, Accelerated MBA, Executive MBA, MSc in Management, Master of Management in Analytics, and PhD) as well as non-degree executive development, open enrollment, and customized corporate programs through The Ivey Academy. Ivey is affiliated with Western University with its main campus located in London, Ontario, midway between Toronto and Detroit.

The School also has three executive teaching facilities: Ivey’s Donald K. Johnson Centre located in the Exchange Tower in Toronto’s financial district, at the Spencer Leadership Centre in London, Ontario, and the Cheng Yu Tun Management Institute in the Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre.

jobDescription:
Senior Data Analyst (Senior Machine Learning Developer)Business ServicesEdmontonPermanent Full-Time
At WCB-Alberta, we make a meaningful impact in the lives of working Albertans. We are a not-for-profit organization legislated to administer the workers' compensation system for the province. When any Alberta worker is hurt on the job, we are here to help. We provide compensation and benefits for workplace injuries and occupational diseases to over 1.7 million workers. Every day, we work hard to make a positive difference in the lives of our customers. At WCB-Alberta, you too can make a difference.
Responsibilities:Partner with various business units with a focus on designing actionable solutions using predictive analytics, clustering algorithms, information retrieval system, recommender system, natural language processing, etc.Work collaboratively and effectively in cross-functional teams. With enhanced team cohesion, increase internal adoption of test design, statistical measurement, and advanced analytics methodologies.Stay on track to project timelines, scope, and other commitments to prove yourself and your team as a reliable business partner.Stay up-to-date and implement the best data and software development (SQL, Python, ML) approaches.Strictly adhere to legal and compliance guidelines, regarding access and exposure to sensitive and confidential informationBuild processes for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) of data from a wide variety of data sources. Maintain the data pipeline processes to manage the flow of data from source to the analytic models and the flow of model outcomes to target destinations. Develop data models and capture metadata associated with model solutions. Establish and maintain a model deployment platform, working in partnership with Information Management and the data science team. Analyze potential impacts of system architecture and infrastructure changes on WCB data science solutions, working in collaboration with Business Intelligence Analysts, Business Analysts, and IT teams. Establish, maintain, and adhere to processes and standards for model development and deployment at the WCB.Analyze data to establish best fit for use by the Data Science team as data sources for machine learning model development. Build processes for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) of data from a wide variety of data sources maintain the data pipeline processes to manage the flow of data from source to the analytic models and the flow of model outcomes to target destinations. Develop data models and capture metadata associated with model solutions. Establish and maintain a model deployment platform, working in partnership with Information Management. Analyze potential impacts of system architecture and infrastructure changes on WCB data science solutions, working in collaboration with Business Intelligence Analysts, Business Analysts, and IT teams. Establish, maintain, and adhere to processes and standards for model deployment at the WCB.Define, implement, and manage monitoring processes for production models, including visualization solutions. Monitor the expected and actual business benefits of production models and coordinate activities to address any issues that arise. Act as the liaison between the business and the Data Science team to track application/data changes and potential impacts to production models.Establish model development standards and governance for the Machine Learning TeamProvide guidance and mentorship to junior Data Analysts
Qualifications:EducationMaster’s Degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Actuarial Science, Economics or Engineering.A Bachelor’s Degree with relevant experience will also be considered.
Tools and TechnologiesAt least 2 years of experience in SQL and Python, working in cloud environments – Databricks preferred.
Data Science ExperienceAt least 2 years of experience in analytical roles working with large data sets and analytic tools, and some subset of the following: scikit-learn, Tensorflow, PyTorch. Good understanding of Natural Language Processing and/or Computer Vision. Experience in software engineering is an assetExperience with data preparation techniques such as cleansing, wrangling, and feature engineering for machine learning and data mining.Knowledge of statistical methods such as linear regression, tree-based regression/classification, time series analysis, clustering and factor analysis. 
Data Pipeline and AcquisitionExperience with process modeling, data modeling, governance/process documentation and the tools used to model these concepts.Experience with ETL processes and tools (e.g. DataStage, SSIS, Attunity).
Soft skillsExcellent interpersonal, leadership, visualization, and communication skills, including the ability to explain complex technical concepts in simple business terms while working closely with end-users and executives.Essentials for this role: Critical thinking, problem-solving, storytelling skills, dedicated, multi-tasking and working in a fast-paced environment, and strong detail orientation.An ideal team player and self-starter – this role is a hybrid location, meaning you will work effectively remotely but can meet your team and business clients as needed in-person in an office environment to collaborate for maximum speed-of-delivery and effectiveness.
Nice to HaveWorking knowledge of experimental and observational research design is an asset. Project management experience is an asset.Familiarity with public sources of socioeconomic data is an asset.Working knowledge of rehabilitative medicine, health care and/or economics is an asset.
About Us:We offer competitive salaries, a comprehensive benefits package, flexible work schedules and hybrid work opportunities that foster a healthy work-life balance, supportive leadership, and a caring and collaborative work environment. For more information, please see our Employee Handbook on our website: https://www.wcb.ab.ca/assets/pdfs/public/employee_handbook.pdf 
Salary: Grade 12 Start Rate: $85,008 to Job Rate: $108,866 per annum (includes Market Supplement)
Note: Final candidates for this position will be asked to undergo a security clearance.
How to Apply: Please apply online by submitting a cover letter and resume to https://www.wcb.ab.ca/about-wcb/careers/. Applications are encouraged from far and wide but successful candidates will need to work from Edmonton, AB. 
We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only candidates under consideration will be contacted. Posted: August 5, 2022 Closes: August 21, 2022
companyDescription:
WCB-Alberta was created by government to administer the Workers' Compensation Act for the province's workers and employers. Funded by employer premiums, we provide cost-effective disability and liability coverage for work-related injury and illness. We compensate workers for lost income and coordinate the health care and other services they need to recover after a workplace injury.

We strive for fairness in our decisions that affect nearly two million workers we cover, and the nearly 170,000 employers whose contributions fund worker benefits, return-to-work programs, and health care services.

Start your career at WCB-Alberta

Our people make a meaningful difference in the lives of working Albertans. When faced with the unfortunate circumstance of a workplace injury, we are here to connect with empathy and understanding. When any Alberta worker is hurt on the job, we will help.

WCB is a great place to work

Over 96% of our staff agree. We offer competitive salaries, a robust benefits package, work-life balance, supportive leadership and a caring and collaborative work environment. We have talented employees who work hard and we want to make sure they’re happy.

Why choose WCB?

We fit your values: Every day, we work hard to make a positive difference in the lives of our customers. 
We fit your life: Great people deserve great benefits that support not just them, but their family, too.
We fit your career: We want our employees to succeed and are committed to offering the learning opportunities they need to grow both personally and professionally. 

Connect with us

We're active on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram and YouTube. Our Social Media Terms of Use apply to you when you interact with us through these social media channels. Please read the Terms carefully and do your part to maintain a safe and respectful environment: https://www.wcb.ab.ca/social

jobDescription:
Draft (formerly Contentfly) is building the content infrastructure that companies leverage to build, scale, and optimize their revenue engines. We're a fully remote and distributed team of high performers on a mission to help companies tell their stories. We're a Series A company backed by Khosla Ventures, YCombinator & other top-tier investors, we've grown to have an incredibly talented team of 50+ people and $8m in ARR in the last year and a half. With a world-class talent marketplace and a team that consistently raises the bar, we have an opportunity to build an all-in-one platform for exceptional content marketing.

Reporting to the Head of Analytics, the Data Analyst is responsible for working across multiple teams to provide various reporting and insights to help guide decision making throughout the organization.

You Are
Data Driven, you love the problems data can solve and the story it can tell A Self-Starter, you’re skilled in your craft but eager to improve and find ways to keep optimizing Detail Oriented, you have a high standard of data quality and integrity Collaborative, you enjoy working with several cross functional teams on daily basis 
Your Key Responsibilities

Here’s what you’ll be doing day to day…
Analysis/Reporting: Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide regular, timely and accurate reports. Build key data sets to empower stakeholders to perform their own analysis. Develop dashboards, track metric progress and investigate changes. Collaboration : Work across Product, Sales, Marketing and Success teams to define key metrics, monitor those metrics and propose next steps. Work with revenue ops to centralize data reporting. Advise engineering, product, and revenue teams on sound statistical practices Continuous Improvement: scale the business by turning one-off analyses into automated processes via high-quality code. Manage various pipelines/automations. 
Your Experience And Intangible Traits

The ideal candidate for the Data Analyst position will possess the following skills and competencies:
 1- 2 years of hands-on experience in a Data Analysis function, ideally in a fast paced or startup environment  High proficiency with SQL and Python for data analysis.  High proficiency with Looker, Tableau, or a comparable BI tool.  Strong communication skills, ability to collaborate with non-technical users is essential.  Strong analytical skills; outstanding attention to detail gathering and analyzing data. 
Why You'll Love Working Here
Unlimited vacation/PTO + Stock OptionsFully remote and distributed teamsFull Health benefitsPaid Parental LeaveFree laptop and home office budget, we've also got your cellphone/internet covered too!Ongoing training and education budgetsWe'll fly you around the world multiple times a year to hang out with the Draft Picks in interesting places
Like what you see and think you’re a perfect fit? Apply today.

Please be assured we'll treat any information you share with us with the utmost care, only use your information for recruitment purposes and will never sell it to other companies for marketing purposes. Please review our privacy policy for further information.

Draft is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to creating a culture with a diversity of talented individuals who join, stay, and work in an environment that enables them to thrive. Draft is committed to providing accommodations. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.
companyDescription: Helping companies tell stories at scale. Get quality content on demand.

jobDescription:
Opentext - The Information Company

As the Information Company, our mission at OpenText is to create software solutions and deliver services that redefine the future of digital. Be part of a winning team that leads the way in Enterprise Information Management.

Life At Opentext

At OpenText and in IT, we believe in every employee having meaningful, purposeful work. By joining our team, you will join a community of supportive and collaborative peers focused on innovation, teamwork, and driving successful outcomes. You’ll be expected to bring with you an ideation and “Yes, if” mindset. And, as you build your network and demonstrate your professional excellence, you will have the opportunity to forge your own career path and professional growth.

The Opportunity

OpenText is looking for a candidate with strong SAP master data background and data analysis skills to be part of a diverse team with a focus on projects relating to data governance, master data architecture and management.

As the Senior Data Analyst, your role is to be the expert in master data structure, design, governance and use across the organization. You will be working on data migration projects that deal with legacy master data from our acquired companies (M&A) into OpenText systems, ensuring business requirements are met and business processes are aligned. The primary objects you would focus on include Vendor master and its multiple attributes, banking rules, P2P processes. You will need to understand the flow and impact of master data objects to downstream systems and other transactional objects. You should be able to work with cross functional business as well as IT teams and be able to share the data analysis across these teams.

What You Will Do
Deep understanding the SAP ERP master data ecosystem, including the fields, tables, and types of transactions which use the master data.Understanding of data integrations, specifically how master data from SAP can impact downstream systems.Understanding the Procure to Pay (P2P) is a must-have. Experience with a Vendor Management System such as AribaKnowledge of Orders to Cash (O2C) and Record to Report (R2R) business streams is an asset.Building and maintaining cross-functional relationships, including aligning opinions and approaches across disparate teams.Using Excel for advanced data manipulations and analysis.Assisting with designing business processes to be aligned to the master data Creating or contributing to SOPs for the operational team.Ensuring data accuracy, integrity, and completeness.
What It Takes
8+ years working with SAP or a similar ERP for maintaining master data, OR, a combination of master data management/governance experience and experience within Procure to Pay (P2P), or Orders to Cash (O2C),Record to Report (R2R) business streams.Experience with data migrations and integrationsAdvanced Excel skills to perform data manipulations and analysis.Knowledge and experience with master data tools such as SAP MDG, Data Services, Information Steward; General understanding of project lifecycle & development Excellent collaboration skillsEnsure adherence to change control processBachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field or a combination of education and equivalent experience7+ years of providing data solutions in a similar setting. 10+ years IT experienceStrong verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills
OpenText's efforts to build an inclusive work environment go beyond simply complying with applicable laws. Our Employment Equity and Diversity Policy provides direction on maintaining a working environment that is inclusive of everyone, regardless of culture, national origin, race, color, gender, gender identification, sexual orientation, family status, age, veteran status, disability, religion, or other basis protected by applicable laws. Should you require accommodations during the selection process, please contact accommodationrequests@opentext.com.

Subject to applicable laws and regulations, OpenText’s global vaccination policy requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter an OpenText office. Accommodations may be available for specific roles.

jobDescription:
Candidate Value Proposition
The successful candidate will have the opportunity to gain exposure to different teams within Global Banking Markets (not just onboarding), work within data team that works with multiple jurisdictions in Capital Markets, exposure to not only the technical side but also the business side and project work, and if extended the contractor could gain exposure to Fenergo system upgrade down the line.
Typical Day In Role
 The Analyst, Client Onboarding Reporting and Analytics, supports the KYC/AML regulatory onboarding teams, as well as other internal stakeholders by providing timely, relevant and accurate metrics to assist with ongoing design and coordination of KYC and Regulatory onboarding activities. Identify, analyze and interpret trends in complex date sets that pertain to client and regulatory data. Support development of MIS and ad hoc reporting capability from customer and regulatory onboarding data contained in source system. Assist with design and preparation of reports on daily basis to support regulatory and operational reporting activities as well as Fenergo Upgrade Project. Continually acquire and enhance knowledge of both the Bank’s and the Division's business strategies, shifting regulatory environment, evolving risk management practices and methodologies, new products, updated operational processes, and rapidly changing technology to be able to drive effective business solutions. Actively support efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, AML/ATF risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory Compliance Risk Management Framework, AML/ATF Global Handbook and the Guidelines for Business Conduct. Support any requests for the development of audit and regulatory documentation which may be required on an ad-hoc basis. Establish and maintain the accuracy, currency and integrity of client data and documents as relates to AML / KYC and Regulatory onboarding activity: organize and independently validate client data and documentation, utilize commercial awareness and prudent judgment to independently validation missing or insufficient information, prepare commentary to support analysis and assessment of AML / KYC risk and outline recommendations for the client coverage team; manage business and client expectations for timely completion of onboarding. Comprehensively prepare KYC forms for sign-off by relevant business heads and compliance by evaluating AML / KYC risk supported by robust analysis and assessment.
Candidate Requirements/Must Have Skills
 3+ years of demonstrated experience with SQL – creating and running queries 3+ years as a Data Analyst, preferably within banking 3+ years’ experience working with Business Intelligence reporting tools (eg. Tableau, PowerBI) Strong stakeholder management skills
Nice-To-Have Skills
 AML/KYC experience Regulatory experience
Soft Skills Required
 The incumbent must be a creative, self-starting, results-oriented, and highly motivated individual with excellent analytical skills. Must have excellent interpersonal, communication and negotiation skills in order to build consensus and obtain co-operation from a multitude of stakeholders, including business users, technology and operations partners, compliance, and management.
Best vs Average: A candidate who has a combination of MH and NTH, a strong technical data analyst who has banking experience in AML/KYC, SQL experience and strong communication/stakeholder management skills.
Education
 Bachelor's degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or related field required.
Candidate Review & Selection
1-2 rounds – 30 minute MS Teams video interviews
Hiring Manager’s Availability To Interview
HM away Sept 7-29, her Director will be looking after process in that time.

jobDescription:
LOCATION: Toronto Hybrid

Who We Are

Moneris was created as a joint investment between RBC and BMO Bank of Montreal (including Harris Bank) in December 2000. By maintaining the tradition of security and strength of our parent banks, today we are Canada's #1 processor, and one of North America's largest.

We are re-imagining commerce and shaping the future of FinTech. To do that, we empower our teams to redefine what's possible, enable them with the right tools and resources, and support them every step of the way.

Connect. Impact. Grow. Join one of Canada's top employers and make your mark at Moneris.

What You'll Do

This position is accountable for providing analysis, modelling, administration, advice and governance to our North American sales compensation programs, working cross-functionally with Pricing, Finance, Sales and Human Resources to ensure our compensation programs drive performance and are aligned to the compensation philosophy of Moneris.
Calculate all sales commission payments for all sales teams, and ensure payouts are accurate and communicated within the required time frameIn partnership with sales management, analyze all new and existing commission plans (components, thresholds, multipliers, etc.) and ensure alignment to revenue targets and strategyDevelop annual plan documents and work with sales management to ensure communication is timely and consistent, collect and maintain all acknowledgment formsPerform complex analyses of commission issues, develop potential solutions, and make recommendations to internal Human Resources team and/or sales managementActs as first line of contact for commission disputes and reconciliation, escalating issues as appropriateRun monthly sales and commission reporting, as requiredLead or participate, as required, in developing training materials on compensation policies, processes and systems to sales teamProvide analytical support to the Company’s annual sales conference and sales recognition programServes as subject matter expert on all commission plans

What You Bring

Must-have experience, knowledge, skills & abilities
Education and/or Professional DesignationUniversity Degree in Business/ Finance/ Human Resources or a related field of studyEquivalent work experience may be considered a substitution3-5 years of relevant work experience in Human Resources, Finance or Data AnalyticsPrevious experience in the payment processing or card industry is considered an assetAdvanced knowledge with Microsoft Windows/ MS Office Applications/Tableau / SQL programmingRequires advanced knowledge of Excel and MS Access along with the ability to work with large Excel datasets - build complex models, and extract key information quickly. Knowledge of pivot tables, vlookups, and formulas a mustBilingual (French/English) considered an assetSuperior attention to detail and accuracy focused including skill with numeric detailExcellent problem solving, analytical and research skills in order to gather informationAbility to display a high degree of confidentiality and professional judgmentStrong organizational skillsFlexible and adaptable to changing business conditions

What You Get
The chance to be part of one of Canada’s top employers and leader in FinTechCompetitive pay and annual bonus program based on individual performance and productivityEmphasis on Wellness - Meeting Free Fridays (MF2), company-wide holiday closure, just to name a fewRRSP matching & defined contribution pension plan Flexible benefits package starting from day 1 Thrive in a Hybrid or Remote Model - including a tech peripheral rebate!Extensive learning & development programs and resources - plus unlimited free access to LinkedIn Learning and Udemy courses! Lots of opportunities to advance your career – 30% of Moneris' roles are filled internallyEAP (Employee Assistance Program), Educational Assistance and Recognition ProgramEmployee perk program with incredible discounts for over 2,400 vendors!Get involved in one or many of our Moneris Committees and Employee Resource Groups - Inclusive Workplace Council (IWC), Black Employee Network, just to name a few

Who You'll Work With

As an integral part of the Moneris team, our Finance Department is made up of analytical and critical thinkers within five key functions; Controllership, Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A), Corporate Data Analytics, Treasury. We are united by our mission to provide insights on key analytics and trends to support our teams in making the right business decisions. We are responsible for protecting the assets of Moneris and ensuring there are sufficient funds to support operations, merchant settlements, and growth.

Check out our careers hub to learn more about life at Moneris!

Note: We welcome and encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, people of colour, people with disabilities, people of all genders, sexual orientation and intersectional identities.

jobDescription:
Come Work with Us!
At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.
Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.
Job Title
Regulatory Data Analyst
Job Description
What is the opportunity?
Reporting to the Senior Manager – Client Regulatory Data, the Regulatory Data Analyst position plays a key role in supporting the KYC Operation, data management strategy and goals for RBC Capital Markets, specifically around Regulatory data.
As part of an evolving and maturing data management function, this role is responsible for the accuracy, management and maintenance of the regulatory counterparty data.
The Regulatory Data Analyst will have an in depth knowledge of internal systems specifically the Counterparty Data Repository (CDR), and will have a sound Counterparty and Regulatory data knowledge base. You are responsible to ensure the operational processes within the Regulatory Team are present, are followed and ensure the Regulatory data within CDR is accurate and well maintained. You will support other team members as appropriate and ensure agreed upon SLAs are met. The Regulatory Data Analyst will assist and support regulatory initiatives within Client Regulatory and KYC Operations (CRKO) and build strong relationships with stakeholders and business partners.
What will you do?
Support the operational processes that ensure the content of CDR meets business, data quality, and regulatory requirements and standardsInterface and build strong relationships with internal clients and external vendors as they relate to Regulatory Counterparty Data Management Support the daily activities/tasks and maintain the Regulatory Inbox Support regulatory initiatives and data analysisExecute UAT testing activitiesSupport the capture, measure, and report metrics on the dimensions of data quality that support business defined objectivesMonitor the EMIR portfolio reconciliation group mailbox
What you need to succeed?
Post-secondary education in Finance, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, Math or a related fieldDemonstrates solid knowledge of the counterparty and regulatory domain and an understanding of how the counterparty data management function intersects with other areas in Operations and RBC Capital MarketsUnderstands and has direct experience with data management concepts of data matching, cleansing, exception management and reportingExpertise in analyzing counterparty reference data sets; must possess advance Excel knowledgeAbility to build and mature working relationships with colleagues within Data Management and RBC business partnersExcellent communication skills – written and oralStrong troubleshooting and problem solving skills
What’s in it for you? 
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensationLeaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing teamOpportunities to do challenging workFlexible work/life balance options
Job Summary
Reporting to the Senior Manager – Client Regulatory Data, the Regulatory Data Analyst position plays a key role in supporting the KYC Operation, data management strategy and goals for RBC Capital Markets, specifically around Regulatory data. As part of an evolving and maturing data management function, this role is responsible for the accuracy, management and maintenance of the regulatory counterparty data.
The Regulatory Data Analyst will have an in depth knowledge of internal systems specifically the Counterparty Data Repository (CDR), and will have a sound Counterparty and Regulatory data knowledge base. You are responsible to ensure the operational processes within the Regulatory Team are present, are followed and ensure the Regulatory data within CDR is accurate and well maintained. You will support other team members as appropriate and ensure agreed upon SLAs are met. The Regulatory Data Analyst will assist and support regulatory initiatives within Client Regulatory and KYC Operations (CRKO) and build strong relationships with stakeholders and business partners.

jobDescription:
Data Analyst, Marketing Growth Programs - ( 220002SQ )

Description

Grow with the best. Join a smart, creative, and inspired team that accomplishes operational excellence. Bringing together individuals with diverse backgrounds, talents, and expertise, our 25,000 team members in over 400 locations worldwide are vital to making our Company stronger.

Your Opportunity

We have an exciting opportunity for a data analyst supporting Stantec’s marketing growth programs. In this role you will develop insights into the performance and impact of enterprise level growth programs and campaigns. This role reports to the Market Research & Intelligence Director.

Your Key Responsibilities
Develop analytics for Stantec’s growth programsDevelop and analyze reports that provide actionable insights into the performance and impact of enterprise level programs and initiatives on top line growthBuild and maintain interactive and user-friendly data visualizations, dashboards and analysis toolsManage accurate reporting of key data metrics used for operational decision-makingCommunicate findings to key stakeholders in a relatable and timely mannerHelp marketing and business development teams understand the how specific program activities, such as strategic growth initiatives, corporate campaigns, account management, and strategic pursuits, are connected to key business outcomesDesign, execute and analyze tests for performance and direct marketing effortsWork collaboratively with governance stakeholders to identify and fix data quality issuesAnalyze patterns to better understand performance and identify actionable insights from the dataRegularly meet with stakeholders in marketing and IT related to data needs and usageCollaborate with stakeholders to align data requirements with business strategy objectivesBuild strong documentation using common data definitionsApply quality processes for the delivery of business intelligence solutions
Qualifications

Your Capabilities and Credentials
Problem-solving, analytical, and critical thinking skillsStrong reporting skills to present insights conciselyStrong business knowledgeAble to work with other departments to implement new tools and processesKnowledge of data architectureExperience working with and merging large datasets and developing detailed logical analysesProficiency with modern data tools, specifically SQL and PowerBI
Education And Experience
Post-secondary degree in business, data analytics, computer science, or an equivalent level of experienceMinimum 5 years of experience in data analytics and visualization, preferably in a business-to-business professional services environment
This description is not a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that may be required of the employee and other duties, responsibilities and activities may be assigned or may be changed at any time with or without notice.

Stantec is a place where the best and brightest come to build on each other’s talents, do exciting work, and make an impact on the world around us. Join us and redefine your personal best

companyDescription:
We're active members of the communities we serve. That's why at Stantec, we always design with community in mind. 

The Stantec community unites approximately 26,000 employees working in over 400 locations across six continents. We collaborate across disciplines and industries to bring buildings, energy and resource, environmental, and infrastructure projects to life. Our work—engineering, architecture, interior design, landscape architecture, surveying, environmental sciences, project management, and project economics, from initial project concept and planning through design, construction, and commissioning—begins at the intersection of community, creativity, and client relationships. 

Our local strength, knowledge, and relationships, coupled with our world-class expertise, have allowed us to go anywhere to meet our clients'​ needs in more creative and personalized ways. With a long-term commitment to the people and places we serve, Stantec has the unique ability to connect to projects on a personal level and advance the quality of life in communities across the globe. Stantec trades on the TSX and the NYSE under the symbol STN. Visit us at stantec.com or find us on our other social media channels.

jobDescription:
Job Description

We are a large and established organization that is a leader in the energy space!

We are hiring for an intermediate or senior level SQL and BI specialist. Besides SQL, some of the skills we are looking for include ETL and data visualization. Aside from the technical aspect, great communication skills are needed for this role because you will be client facing from time to time.

We are the kind of company where you will be working in a very stable firm that isn't going anywhere. There's probably no better time to work in a recession proof company and have the opportunity to grow within our organization.

If all that excites you, then don’t hesitate to apply!

Required Skills & Experience
3+ years of professional experience as a SQL, DBA, Data Analyst or equivalentStrong SQL skillsExperience with ETL toolsExperience with data visualization technologies Desired Skills & Experience
Great communication skills – having the ability to explain what you have done and WHY you have done itSSIS, SSRS, Power BI – not required though What You Will Be Doing

Tech Breakdown
100% SQL, ETL and data visualization 
Daily Responsibilities
80% Hands On20% Team collaboration and client facing The Offer
Bonus 
You Will Receive The Following Benefits
Medical, Dental, Vision Insurance – As of day 1 – 100% covered with no premiums out of your pay chequeRRSP match – 3%Vacation Time
Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the Canada on a full-time basis now and in the future.

companyDescription:
Motion Recruitment delivers IT Talent Solutions for Contract, Direct Hire, Managed Solutions and Statement of Work to all of North America from our 21 delivery centers. Our high-touch, specialized, team-based recruitment model’s success is proven through our exemplary track record in filling the most challenging IT positions for startup and enterprise clients alike. Our hyper-specialized tech focus results in a truly consultative approach for both our clients and candidates, within our recruiting areas of expertise: Software, Mobile, Data, Infrastructure, Cybersecurity, Product + UX and Functional.

Motion also delivers IT Consulting Solutions through the Motion Consulting Group (MCG) that create true digital transformation for IT projects in Agile Development & Coaching, DevOps & DevSecOps Solutions, and Managed Services for IT Operations.
 
We’re also the proud creators of Tech in Motion and the Timmy Awards, our North American community platform, events series and award program that connects over 250,000 tech enthusiasts to meet, learn, and innovate.

jobDescription:
About Agoda
Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 4,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.
 In this Role, you’ll get  to: 
Search: Experiment with text ads, bidding, and campaign structures on Google, Bing, Baidu, Naver, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful testsDisplay: Test, analyze, and optimize campaigns on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and othersModeling: Analyze the vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop models we can use for optimization, and build dashboards for account managers

companyDescription:
Agoda is transforming travel for millions of customers across the globe. 

Headquartered in Asia, Agoda is one of the world’s largest online travel platforms. Founded in 2005 and now part of Booking Holdings (Nasdaq:BKNG), Agoda has a network of over 2,900,000 properties worldwide. Our web and mobile products provide a first-rate reservation service in 38 languages that uniquely combines local knowledge and local connections to provide the best deals for business and leisure travelers.

Agoda employs over 7,000 professionals from 90 nationalities in locations around the globe. In every department – from engineering to customer experience – we provide an environment rich with creativity, collaboration, and experimentation, and the tools to work faster and smarter.

At Agoda, we believe our people are our strength. We work hard and have fun, and we choose people who are dedicated to making things great.

For properties seeking partnership with Agoda, visit https://connect.agoda.com

jobDescription:
Job Description
 Degree/Certifications Required: Undergraduate or graduate degree in quantitative discipline  Years of experience: 2-4  Reason for request/why opened: increase in workload  % Interaction with Stakeholders: 25% outside team, 75% within team  Team Size: 10  Personality Style: agile intuitive mindset, mix of technical with functional communication, easily communicate with multiple stakeholders  Team Culture: Small team, fast paced dynamic environment, looking to work with agile intuitive mindset  Selling Points of Position: Being able to work for a respected bank like TD, small group with a lot of opportunities to work on a variety of projects within a high visibility setting  Best Vs Average Candidate: Great functional communication within and outside of team, agile mindset  How will performance be measured: Verbal feedback 
Summary

Job description:

The Data, Analytics and Reporting (DAR) team is a part of a broader shared strategy group encompassing Strategy & Planning, Data Management and Governance, and Data, Analytics and Reporting supporting 4 LOBs: Global Security and Investigations, Fraud Risk Management, Enterprise Insider Risk Program and Global Privacy. The teams supported represent unique businesses that span both 1st and 2nd line responsibilities within the 3 Lines of Defense model of risk management with an overall united goal of protecting the bank.

Job Responsibilities – Day to Day
 Thrive in a fast paced, dynamic, and unpredictable environment with the ability to adopt to changing priorities  Desire and tenacity to learn new skills and adapt to new challenges that have a steep learning curve, and are a self-starter that pro-actively tackles problems  Implement and maintain performance of reliable ETL pipelines and data models that feed various DAR products  Develop advanced analytical solutions by analyzing/profiling/augmenting data, creating analytic and visualization specific data sets, applying statistical methods, and communicating results through illustrative visualizations to senior technical and non-technical personnel across 4 key LOBs (FRM, GSI, EIRP and Privacy)  Work closely with business partners and FRM, EIRP, GSI and Privacy leadership to solicit, analyze, and understand data requirements to enable development of analytics solutions and manage project requirements, data specifications, priorities, and timelines to ensure timely and accurate deliveries  Understand and adopt an Agile software development mindset by delivering Minimum Viable Products (MVPs) and iteratively enhancing them based on user feedback 
Job Requirements
 Undergraduate or graduate degree in quantitative discipline such as management analytics, computer engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics, economics  2-4 years relevant data and analytics experience  Data – Experience with SQL, and MS server data & tools are a must. Knowledge of Python, SSIS and MS Azure cloud services (such as Azure Data Factory, Databricks, ADLS, Delta Lake, Azure SQL DB and Azure Synapse) is a strong asset.  Visualization – Experience creating analytic or visualization data models, utilizing data models to visualize analytic results in Tableau is a must.  Experience with PowerBI is an asset.  Excel and PowerPoint – Knowledge of Excel ETL features such as Power Query considered an asset.  Ability to draft storyboards and execute narratives in PPT common in advisory or consultancy roles is also valued.  Feel free to attach professional or personal work that showcase your abilities. No cover letter required. 
Must Haves
 SQL, and MS server data & tools  Undergraduate or graduate degree in quantitative discipline  Data and analytics experience 
Nice To Haves
 PowerBI and/or Tableau  Knowledge of Excel ETL features such as Power Query  Draft storyboards and execute narratives in PPT  Python, SSIS and MS Azure cloud
companyDescription:
Robertson & Company Ltd. is a leading professional services firm providing recruitment-related, advisory and consulting services to corporations, professional organizations, governments, and public & private institutions.

RELATIONSHIP VERSUS TRANSACTION

Success in the recruitment services industry depends on deep relationships built on trust and performance. Our focus is never simply on the transaction at hand but on what is best for our client, both today and in the long run. We consider this unique approach and perspective to be the driving force behind our continued success in this highly competitive space.

DEEP INDUSTRY EXPERIENCE 

While we work with many industries, Robertson & Company has exceptional experience and a proven track record with some of North America's leading financial institutions. We understand the needs of the industry and its inner workings better than any other recruitment firm. This is evidenced by our enviable client retention rate of nearly 100%.

A PROVEN TRACK RECORD

In our world, longevity is based on consistently delivering time and time again. Robertson & Company has just such a proven track record of performance. Our commitment to exceptional client communication, the use of proprietary screening and selection processes and an uncompromising commitment to excellence has served both us and our clients well.

Robertson is a Proud Certified Diversity Supplier.

jobDescription:
Job Category
Advisory
Opportunity Awaits at Altus Group!
The opportunity
Our Data Solutions team in Toronto is looking for a new Data Analyst to join us in a hybrid position. You will be part of a highly motivated, multi-disciplinary team of professionals focusing on developing key commercial and residential trends across Canada. You will leverage our proprietary data to provide market intelligence that will guide internal and external decision-making. You will support the generation of monthly and quarterly reports related to Canada's housing markets by preparing the background files and associated analytics. You will liaise and collaborate with industry professionals and information partners to achieve objectives and maintain the consistent and timely provision of market trends.
What's In It For You
Exposure and career growth. You will be part of an organization that works on an exciting range of commercial property projects across the country, a place recognized at the top of our industry. You will gain access to our proprietary databases used by the global industry and gain insights into our services and the Canadian development market. You will be mentored and grow your knowledge as you foster relationships with internal team members and have the chance to work on a variety of deliverables from research to data entry, from report writing to drafting property descriptions.
What You Will Do
Analyze. You will develop quality assurance procedures for data, evaluating for completion and accuracy. You will process and analyze data sets, synthesize information for market research, create dashboards, and develop models and charts. You will play a key role in expanding our commercial and residential real estate market analytics.Collaborate. You will work with the research consulting and marketing teams in developing, visualizing and writing periodic market trend reports covering various real estate sectors. You will support the Manager, Research Insights, with the market forecast initiative.Grow your knowledge. You will attend industry events and meetings, reviewing professional publications, establishing personal networks, and benchmark best practices.
You Will Have
The education and experience. You have a university degree or college diploma in Urban Planning, Geography, Economics, Finance, Business, Real Estate or a related field and 1+ years of experience in real estate research. Ideally, you have exposure to both the Canadian housing market and the commercial real estate or development industry. You have professional writing skills to competently author trend reports.The technical skills. You are proficient in MS Office and Tableau. You have excellent research, and analytical skills. You can process and analyze data sets, synthesize information for market research, create dashboards, and develop models and charts.The drive. You can take the initiative and be resourceful, operating with a high degree of integrity, honesty, and ethics. 
We thank you in advance for taking the time to learn more about what makes Altus a great place to grow your career and do some of your best work. Apply now, refer a friend or stay on top of what's new by following us on LinkedIn.
Come realize your potential at Altus Group!
Altus Group is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment where employees feel valued and respected, and where every employee has the opportunity to realize their potential. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations, if required, and will work with you to meet your needs. If you are a person with a disability and require assistance during the application process, please contact us at accessibility@altusgroup.com or 416-641-9500.

jobDescription:
Come Work with Us!
At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.
Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.
Job Title
HR Data Analyst
Job Description
What is the Opportunity?
RBC, one of Canada’s largest and most respected employers, is looking for a HR Data Analyst to join our growing Talent Data and Analytics team.
Reporting to the Director, HR Data Governance & Data Management, the HR Data Analyst will be a strong execution lead of all facets of HR data governance and management across the HR domain. You will lead root cause analysis and end-to-end data discovery efforts and will provide advice and oversight to our HR Centres of Excellence and our business partners through projects, initiatives, and day to day operational activities related to the management and governance of HR data.
Your quick, problem-solving ability allows you to investigate, analyze, organize and prioritize easily –and is foundational to your success in the role. Your strong ability to work with multiple stakeholders and form positive working relationships will also be helpful. You will interface regularly with SMEs from HR Centres of Excellence, the HR Architecture team and the HR Reporting team as well as our partners in IT, Finance, Chief Data Office and Legal. A key focus for our team and this role in particular is in the proper design of employee data capture processes, to make them more accurate and efficient for employees, managers, and the HR community.
As the right candidate, you are multifaceted, fast-paced, comfortable with change and ambiguity, and understand how to apply design thinking and problem solving skills to projects. You will be excited by opportunities to optimize (and support) our HR data architecture, data governance, and data pipelines. You understand how HR data is increasingly seen as an invaluable asset, and are comfortable collaborating with HR subject matter experts to understand the business requirements.
What will you do?
Understand requirements from businesses to help review, improve and document changes to data definitions, access, usage and management processes Translate business requirements to IT requirementsAdvise on best practices for data usage/security/retention/collection etc. for various projects related to HR data and analyticsEngage in a variety of initiatives supporting HR operations, and strive to evolve the maturity of the HR Data governance programWork with data infrastructure team, data integration teams etc. to execute on projects Document, manage and execute master data validation strategies for the function.Execute analytical audits against a variety of types of HR data to assess data validity and data quality, understand gaps, impact and scope of data issuesCollaborate with other departments on data management related projects and reviews.Support an effective governance communication program for the functionBuild a common repository of HR data knowledge including data dictionaries, dimension and measure definitions, and lineage.Summarize and explain data sets and designs, business processes Support the strategic development of the HR Governance Program through research and analytics. 
What do you need to succeed?
Must have:
5+ years’ experience in a data-driven environment with a strong understanding of data issues, data management and data governance principles. Strong Excel and PowerPoint skillsExperience troubleshooting data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.Experience designing processes to support data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured and sub-optimized datasets.Strong management and organizational skillsExperience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environmentCommunication and presentation skills: ability to summarize and playback analysis, tailor the content for different audiences (technical and non-technical) to drive to impact and help make data-driven decisions. 
Nice-to-have
HR/People data domain experience is preferred.Graduate degree demonstrating the ability to research, learn and problem solve.Experience in agile development and design thinking methodologiesSuperior MS Excel and PowerPointSQL/MySQL or other data query/analytics capabilityComfort with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BIExperience managing a small team would be an asset.
What’s in it for you? 
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensationAbility to make a difference and lasting impactWork in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing teamOpportunities to take on progressively greater scopes of work
RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with hiring manager.
RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

jobDescription:
Summary
Our client provides an open source enterprise-grade messaging platform to many leading organizations to enable their teams to collaborate securely and privately anywhere. With over 10,000 server downloads/month, our customers include Intel, Samsung, Affirm, The US Department of Defense, and more. Our private cloud messaging platform offers secure, configurable, highly scalable messaging using web, mobile, and desktop applications and provides deep integrations with hundreds of SaaS and on-premises tools and applications. We value high impact work, ownership, self-awareness and being focused on customer success. If these values match who you are, we hope you'll learn more and apply!
About The Role
Our client is seeking a passionate data enthusiast to lead our Marketing data analytics. As a data-driven organization, Our client relies on our data team to drive marketing insights, ensure accurate data across systems, iterate on current key business metrics, and dive into complex datasets to answer business-critical questions. In this role, you will work closely with the marketing, sales, product, and engineering organizations to deeply understand customer trends, analyze marketing activities, product adoption, and sales results in order to surface insights that impact the health of the overall business. If you are data-obsessed, love connecting the dots, thrive in an iterative environment, and aren’t afraid to roll up your sleeves and get your hands dirty with data, this is the role for you.
Tool Stack: Marketo, Salesforce, Wordpress, Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Google Optimize, Snowflake, dbt, Stitch, Hightouch, Looker, Google Sheets/Excel, etc.
Coding Languages: SQL, Python, LookML
Responsibilities
 Work with the Marketing team to quantitatively understand problems and potential solutions; analyze disparate data sets in creative ways to generate new understandings of our business. Maintain and enhance analytics infrastructure including data models and visualization tools in cooperation with analysts across the organization. Analyze the performance of campaign launches and experiments using analytics tools, data platforms, and internal databases. Ensure the highest levels of data quality, organization, and reliability. Examine funnel performance, identify issues before they become problems, and suggest solutions. Use historical data to forecast future performance in real time. Surface analytical insights: proactively investigate root causes of aberrant data, and identify opportunities for optimization. Support design and implementation of experimentation necessary to improve channel efficiency, drive growth, and inform marketing investment decisions. Build and maintain dashboards that will capture the Marketing team’s performance against our success metrics. Participate in the definition and measurement of KPIs that will drive the company’s success. Assist in training new hires and colleagues on the workings of our client's data and what it means to be a data-driven culture. Lead strategic cross-functional data initiatives to stitch together our client's customer journey data for internal analytics consumption. Partner with the Data Engineering team to ensure relevant data is centralized into our data warehouse and modeled for performant analytics, while meeting our high data-quality standards.
Required Background/Skills
 4+ years experience with complex data analysis, visualization, and dashboards as part of full-time work, college coursework, personal projects, internships, or research Extensive experience with SQL Demonstrated experience using a data visualization tool such as Looker or Tableau to visualize and model raw data sets Able to proactively engage, communicate, and collaborate with cross-functional business stakeholders Deep understanding of marketing tactics, including campaigns and marketing channels such as SEM, SEO, Social, Events, Display, Content, and Email Knowledge of digital tagging methodologies and tracking. Expertise in new/emerging technologies in digital tracking (URL, cookies, cookie-less approaches). Experience applying probability and statistics to real-world problems; applied experience in experimentation design, A/B testing and/or probabilistic modeling a plus Passion for data and analytics Logical and analytical abilities to help solve problems and derive insights from data Resourceful, self-motivated, and able to successfully complete multiple competing projects under tight deadlines Experience using dbt or other data transformation tools Python experience Bachelor's or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Engineering, Economics, Business, or related discipline

In this role, you will be responsible for the development of reports, and data warehousing, and will turn data into information and create tools to solve the business needs and drive insight to all levels of the organization. You will provide support for the enterprise applications team as required and collaborate on the design and creation of new tools and technologies. Ensuring integrations, security, and data integrity are paramount when designing, implementing, and updating business intelligence tools, configurations, and enhancements.

This role is located in Edmonton and our client has adopted a hybrid model, working from the office Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday for the first three weeks of the month.

Post-secondary degree or diploma in Computer Science or a related fieldThree to five years’ experience in a relevant fieldExperience with data warehouse design and architecture, with a proven ability to refine data and transform it into useful informationExperience in reporting development using a variety of tools & programming languagesExperience as a Power BI developerAzure experienceExperience using software methodologies (both waterfall and agile) through the entire software lifecycleAbility to manage numerous tasks of varying scale and priorityStrong analytical abilities, with the ability to identify problems, determine issues, and implement solutions, often within a time-sensitive frameworkGood planning skills, including the ability to organize, prioritize, and execute within a time-sensitive frameworkExcellent interpersonal skills and effective communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to clearly communicate ideas and proposals and to discuss technical issues with non-technical clientsExperience with the Infor suite of products (e.g., M3, MEC (M3-E-collaborator) XM, d/EPM, Birst, Stream Serve, Infor OS) is considered an assetKnowledge of Enterprise Service Bus and integration methodologies supporting an assortment of enterprise on-premises and cloud-based platforms is considered an assetFluent in English, both written and spokenStrong problem identification and problem resolution skillsAbility to develop and maintain successful professional working relationships with internal departments, key managers, and other stakeholders to further corporate business goalsMust have and maintain a valid Driver’s License (other than a motorcycle), with the ability to travel between the Company’s locations and willing to accept temporary assignment(s) to additional Company locationsAbility to be accessible as required (via company cell phone) to provide after-hours support to corporate employee end-users as required

Job Description

With us, it's always about people

Innovation, excellence, integrity and determination are just some of the core values on which Carmichael is founded. These enduring values serve as guiding principles that have allowed us to thrive as a service provider of HVAC thermal systems for 100 years.

Being part of the Carmichael family translates into endless opportunities to learn and achieve tremendous personal growth. And what's more, we give you carte blanche to apply what you learn so that you can in turn perfect and continuously improve it.

Carmichael is a place where your experience will be valued and respected. If you've ever tasted success and are hungry for more, Carmichael is the perfect place to satisfy your appetite for success.

Tasks And Responsibilities

Reporting to the IT Manager the Data Analyst will create various SQL and Power BI based reports and Dashboards according to the requests coming from the various company departments and senior members of the management team.

The Data Analyst will also play a very important role into the ongoing data base management and optimization. Candidate must be located in Montreal, Quebec.

Database management
Participate into the refinement the logical design of our database for translation into a specific data model, and its physical design to meet system storage requirementsSupervise the data integrity of data collection systems.Establish database performance and schema management, including tables, indexes, and partitionsProvide database monitoring and support for mission-critical applications; document all production databases and interface systemsConstantly monitor and assess database servers to make sure that online and batch processes are operating as designedTroubleshoot database errors and fix system issues via periodic testing, help desk tickets, and other methodsCollaborate with other IT and operational staff to ensure database integrity, security, and ongoing performanceProvide support for development processes by participating in data modeling sessions and advising about database design or use of objects.Plan for database backup and recoveryControl and monitor user access to the databaseAdvise management of new applications or potential system enhancements in support of future requirementsAct as a technical resource during other projects as required
Data analysis and reporting 
Create dashboards and interactive visual reports using Power BIAnalyzing data and present data through reports that aid decision-makingCreate relationships between data and develop tabular and other multidimensional data modelsChart creation and data documentation explaining algorithms, parameters, models, and relationsDesign, develop, test, and deploy Power BI scripts and perform detailed analyticsPerform DAX queries and functions in Power BIRedefine and make technical/strategic changes to enhance existing Business Intelligence systemsCreate customize charts and custom calculations as per requirementsDesign, develop and deploy business intelligence solutions as per needsSQL querying for best results, use of filters and graphs for better understanding of dataWork with users and team members at all level for performance improvement and suggestionsFunction as a main contact for Carmichael Engineering Ltd. business monitoring and reporting, as related to core performance metrics.Facilitate business intelligence gathering, both internal and external.Support management and other stakeholders with proactive reporting to feed decision making.Prepare performance reports for key stakeholders.Develop predictive models to assist with the evaluation of potential business decisions.Make recommendations about the selection of external vendors relating to data metrics.Research and recommend enhancements to data collection systems.Establish and utilize a comprehensive, efficient, and focused process for reporting on business and departmental performance against performance metrics.Ensure the integrity of research project data, including data extraction, processing, storage, manipulation, and analysis.Share knowledge of data coding and analysis techniques with other staff.Provide information and guidance when needed to ensure the success of initiatives or project completion.Create compressive reports for all levels of business and various stakeholders.Resolve issues or disputes within the data analyst department.Other duties as required.
Requirements
More than 5 years’ experience in a similar role - Creating of reports using multiple systems & types of databases, database cleanup and optimization, dashboard creation.Power BI - certification is a very important asset Ability to use SQL / Pivot tablesFriendly and positive manners.Must be able to work in a fast paced environment.Must be able to multitask.English and French required
companyDescription:
Welcome to Carmichael : Where dedication meets excellence

Whether your needs are for commercial  air-conditioning and heating, industrial refrigeration, building automation or scientific services, Carmichael has a history of more than 90 years of proven expertise and innovation. Our invaluable body of knowledge, passed on for three generations, is why our products and services are trusted across Canada.
